column4: hi, i used to have a sound problem and it was fixed by installing linux-alsa-driver-modules-$(uname -r) then after few weeks by get updates of the update manager the sound vanished "nothing is muted" how can i fix this problem ?
what is the output of: wget -O alsa-info.sh http://alsa-project.org/alsa-info.sh && bash ./alsa-info.sh       thanks
you need that script and run it, you can access it via web browser and copy to a text file to be ran instead
run:  gedit ~/alsa-info; bash ./alsa-info         paste in this text: http://git.alsa-project.org/?p=alsa-driver.git;a=blob_plain;f=utils/alsa-info.sh
then....
save the file and close gedit
then upload to the site and give the red URL generated
the script uploads to the alsa site, it makes the link for you
http://paste.ubuntu.com/575035/
: http://paste.ubuntu.com/575035/
thats the script, run it and you will make a link
the command I gave is all you needed. The one which opened gedit. All you had to do was copy the script and paste to gedit and save then close it. The script will then run
: http://www.alsa-project.org/db/?f=cb9a291899dd79a352c954b812504e4cd2f6fcd7
http://www.alsa-project.org/db/?f=cb9a291899dd79a352c954b812504e4cd2f6fcd7
ok, what is your sound issue?
one post is fine, no need to double post
sorry , for double post .....,the problem is no sound i opened youtube ,player nothing
does the headphone jack give you sound?
ill try it
try adding:     options snd-hda-intel model=hpÂ     to /etc/modprobe.d/alsa-base.conf    and reboot, may help
try upgrading to alsa 1.0.23 too: http://monespaceperso.org/blog-en/2010/05/02/upgrade-alsa-1-0-23-on-ubuntu-lucid-lynx-10-04/
